alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 9:47PM CDT until June 30 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following county, Sherman. * WHEN...Until 915 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Beaver Creek, South Beaver Creek, Middle Fork Sappa Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Sherman County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
